metadata.dc:author: Dawid-Milner, S
Jiménez Vargas, J
Díaz Calavia, E
Fernández del Moral, R
metadata.dc:description: The excitability of the visual system was studied in ten adult chronic cats. Visual evoked potentials were recorded, using decreasing interstimulus intervals. A decrease of the excitability of the visual system is observed when interstimulus intervals are less than 800 milliseconds. Clinical applications with regard to visual evoked potential recording on comatose patients are suggested.
metadata.dc:title: Potencial evocado visual experimental. Intervalo interestímulos y excitabilidad cortical.
[Experimental visual evoked potentials. Interstimuli interval and cortical excitability].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista de medicina de la Universidad de Navarra
